file_content.text: Stay back. I don't know you. You aren't of the Dark Path.
She whispers to me, tells me to go back to Lord Pharshol, that I belong to Pharshol, but it's wrong. Something's wrong!
You must be Lord Pharshol's apprentice. He sent me to find you.
Anyarah?
Yes. No. No.
What's wrong?
You're coming with me.
Let's go.
Where are we going? Outside? I remember--is there a city outside...?
I was someone else, before I came to the temple. I was powerful. I was Sith!
But she keeps saying I'm an apprentice... just an apprentice. And I hate her, but my hate isn't making me strong enough.
Who are you, if not an apprentice?
What's going on?
A true Sith's hatred gives infinite power.
Hate will fuel you.
Yes. Yes! I do hate her. I do.
Remember the Sith Code. Focus on the words.
Think of the Sith teachings.
Yes. Through passion, I gain strength... through victory, my chains are broken. The Force shall free me.
Focus. If there's something in your mind, you have to fight it.
Don't let her in.
I'd offer to shoot her, but I think she's in your head.
Not sure I can help.
Ha! But she should die--even though she'd try to take me with her.
Hush. It's okay.
I came into the temple from the city. I remember the lights of the Citadel... and then she pushed it all away.
She says she's Anyarah. She says we serve Pharshol. She says there's no city out there. Just jungle.
Tell me who's right! Am I the temple apprentice Anyarah, or is she lying? Is the city outside real?
Lord Pharshol wants Anyarah, so that's who you are.
I came for Anyarah.
Anyarah. I understand. Thank you. Thank you....
I was confused. Strange. I ran from Lord Pharshol--but my place isn't with the Dark Path. It's by his side.
Pharshol is waiting for you to return.
He's expecting you.
Of course. I'll go to him now. And you should follow soon--he will reward you, I'm sure.
Why did you run from him? You didn't seem yourself.
What confused you?
Madwoman.
I apologize. I was with Pharshol, and I started thinking--I remembered a different life. I remembered coming inside the temple from--
Enough. I will think about it no longer.
I must return to my master. I'll leave you to your business--but know that Pharshol will reward you for what you've done.
Leave me.
Watch out for danger.
Yes. I am in control of my senses, now. The dream has faded, and I can protect myself.
Don't expect more aid.
I will not need your aid again.
Be wary of the Dark Path, and of any others you meet.
Kaas City is real. It's where you're from--this temple is all wrong.
She's lying.
I knew it. Curse her. She's still in my head, but she's--
She's my enemy, and I am Sith. I can defeat her. I will.
Now can you tell me what's going on?
Okay. Let's talk.
Can I aid you?
I see you're still crazy.
You're nuts.
No. I'm struggling, but I'm also remembering. It takes concentration.
I came from Kaas City. Like you. But the temple makes people think... strange things, remember being different people.
I'm not an apprentice. That workman... he isn't Lord Pharshol. But we thought we were. We played the roles. We even had the power.
Why?
There's a power in the temple, and I can feel it. Beyond that, I don't know.
Were your friends here possessed, too?
And these people I fought?
These people... they were slaves. Archaeologists. All of them sent in from the city, all of them... influenced.
No one's making me think strange thoughts.
But I feel fine.
No. Whatever seized me seems to be... distracted, now. I was able to escape, and you seem immune.
I don't know how long my mind will stay my own. So, I need to leave here, now.
Get moving, then. And be careful.
Go.
What am I supposed to tell Lord Pharshol?
What should I do?
Tell him I'm dead. It doesn't matter.
Flee--but remember that you owe me your life.
Be grateful for my help.
I know. And I curse you for it, because I have nothing to repay you with.
I won't keep you. Leave the temple to me.
I can take care of things here.
As you wish, my lord. But I suggest you finish quickly.
Just follow the bodies to the exit.
Yeah, sure.
Tell Imperial Intelligence what's going on, if you can.
Contact my employers.
Yes. I'll let them know where you are.
I suggest you leave the temple quickly--before thoughts enter your head, too.
You aren't of the Dark Path!
